author: pace
title: Cardano scaling solutions
description: Cardanoがスケーラビリティを高めるためには、どのような研究やスケーリングの実装を導入すればよいのでしょうか？

f6_assessments.q0: Getting teams to solve scaling issues is a very significant contribution to the Cardano ecosystem so this challenge aligns well with the mission. It matches with 2 or the 3 strategic goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge is difficult and will require a large budget. With IOG already working on aspects of this solution and the challenge envisioning the potential of a single team taking most or all of the large budget, I have some doubts that the community has the capacity to address the challenge. Given the community drive towards decentralized governance instead of having IOG control, my final assessment is that the capacity probably exists.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are measurable and exceptionally well defined.

f6_assessments.q0: I think this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission as it aims to propose scalability solutions for Cardano in those areas Hydra now couldn't like rollups, sharding, sidechains or state channels.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge with capable human resources and foundation of the ecosystem. Budget $1 million is pretty high compared to other last challenges about scaling-up Cardano and boosting up Cardano's Defi. Therefore I only rate 4 for its feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: I think success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure the progress of proposals. However, some guiding questions and directions for proposals should be added.

f6_assessments.q0: Since scalability is a very core criterium of Cardano and scaling issues already start to show up in more complex problems like Dexes, I think this challenge proposal has the potential to have a very positive impact.
f6_assessments.q1: The catalyst community has quite talented Devs and some people with expertise in various areas that might be affected by scalability. The deep understanding of the blockchain that is required to adress advanced scalability solutions however could really limit the numbers of worthy contenders. Also, close cooperation with IOG will still be neccessary to not create any redundant or conflicting solutions and will also make the success of community solutions dependent on the progress of Hydra.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are well set up and enable solutions going into various directions while they are not too open to hinder concrete approaches.

f6_assessments.q0: As the ecosystem grows scaling solutions are an inevitable measure to help scale and maintain the continuity of the system.  This fund setting challenge would have a massive impact to the future-proofing of the chain by performing the research and development of future scaling solutions in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: This fund challenge setting would be quite feasible to enable proposers and teams to begin understanding the technical requirements to build and develop scaling solutions to help maintain the future congestion that the system could potential see as growth and adoption occur.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this fund challenge setting could be research and development driven from the type of proposals that would be submitted there is a chance that no concrete products maybe ready, but documented research and findings could be developed and used as milestones for measuring the progress of the proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: Improving scalability is critical to all blockchains given its foundational to the trilemma hence this challenge is impactful and aligns well with Cardano's mission. However, at the risk of being labelled 'subjective' I don't agree strongly enough to give this proposal five stars because I cite the proposer's own subjectivity by stating, "Hydra will not solve every scaling problem in Cardano". I question the basis for this assumption and would argue that Hydra's theoretical 2 million tps will solve the scaling problem. But that in itself is an assumption hence the question, why don't we wait and see? This challenge may well be required but maybe at a later funding stage when Hydra is released and demonstrates that there is room for improvement required, or that we may want alternatives to Hydra to expand our scaling options.
f6_assessments.q1: As the proposer also admits, the $1000000 purse may well be required by a single proposal due to the scale (excuse the pun) of any projects tackling this issue. That aside, it lists a number of potential avenues that can tackle this problem naming; rollups, sharing, state channels and side chains could be the focus of any proposals submitted. Certainly milkomedia.io who will soon release their EVM sidechain are marketing the possibilities in the area so this challenge may well prove to be feasible. I only provided four stars for this challenge because the expenditures required for such scaling projects could perhaps look to CF to fund advances in this area, who may well validate any projects with more sophistication.
f6_assessments.q2: Any projects or proposals submitted to this potential challenge should have a host of auditable points; number of proposals, expertise of teams involved, githubs, relative success of projects, etc. This challenge in a way is a de facto Developer Ecosystem challenge albeit more specific to 'scaling'so in a way, auditability of this challenge can be replicated from current/previous challenges despite not being specifically identified in this proposals.

f6_assessments.q0: There is no doubt that this challenge setting is definitely needed now and even in future. There has to be inbuilt alternatives to tackle a potential threat of overload on the network from the expected increased demand from users.
f6_assessments.q1: The community has capable and experienced hands to collaborate and bring lasting solutions to tackling the goals and objectives of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metrics proposed is well adequate and sufficient to assess the performance of the challenge accordingly.

importance: Hydraはカルダノのすべてのスケーリング問題を解決するものではなく、代替となるより多くのスケーリングソリューションが必要です。
success: Cardanoプロジェクトが使用を開始できる、コミュニティによって導入・実装されるスケーリングソリューション
